title: How to Import Bookmarks from Another Computer: Full Guide

steps.title: Plug a flash drive into your computer.
steps.content: Plug a flash drive into your computer. A flash drive is probably the easiest way to quickly transfer your bookmarks to another computer. [1] X Research source If you don’t have a flash drive, you can attach the bookmark file to an email message instead. You can also upload the file to a cloud service, such as iCloud , Google Drive , or OneDrive .

steps.title: Open Chrome and click ⁝.
steps.content: Open Chrome and click ⁝ . It’s at the top-right corner of the browser on Windows and Mac. A menu will expand. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Bookmarks and lists.
steps.content: Select Bookmarks and lists . Another menu will expand. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Bookmark manager.
steps.content: Click Bookmark manager . It’s near the middle of the menu. [4] X Research source A new page will open.

steps.title: Click ⁝.
steps.content: Click ⁝ . It’s at the top-right corner of the Bookmarks page. You'll see this on the right of the Search bookmarks . [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Export Bookmarks.
steps.content: Click Export Bookmarks . This opens your computer’s file browser. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to the location where you want to save the bookmarks.
steps.content: Navigate to the location where you want to save the bookmarks. If you’re using a flash drive, browse to the flash drive in the file browser. If you’re going to email yourself the bookmarks or upload it to a cloud service, navigate to your Downloads folder (or anywhere else that’s easy to remember). If you have the cloud service connected to your computer, navigate to its folder.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Your bookmarks will save to the selected location as an HTML file. When the file is finished saving, safely eject the drive from your computer. If you’re emailing the bookmarks to yourself, open your email client, compose a new message to yourself, attach the file , then click the send button.

steps.title: Plug the flash drive into the new computer.
steps.content: Plug the flash drive into the new computer. [7] X Research source If you emailed yourself the bookmarks or uploaded them to a cloud service, log into your account from the new computer, open the message or file, and then download the HTML attachment.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome on the new computer.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome on the new computer. Be sure to download Google Chrome on the new computer if you haven't already. If you want to transfer to a different browser, skip to the importing steps for Mozilla Firefox , Safari , or Microsoft Edge .

steps.title: Open the Bookmark Manager on the new computer.
steps.content: Open the Bookmark Manager on the new computer. In Chrome, click the ⁝ at the top-right corner of the browser, select Bookmarks , then click Bookmark manager .

steps.title: Click ⁝.
steps.content: Click ⁝ . This is at the top-right corner of the page.

steps.title: Click Import Bookmarks.
steps.content: Click Import Bookmarks . If you’re using Chrome, this opens the computer’s file browser.

steps.title: Browse to the bookmark file.
steps.content: Browse to the bookmark file. If you saved the file to a flash drive, navigate to the flash drive. If you downloaded the file from an email message or cloud service, navigate to the folder in which you saved it. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Select the bookmark file and click Open.
steps.content: Select the bookmark file and click Open . This will import your bookmarks into the new browser.

steps.title: Move the bookmarks (optional).
steps.content: Move the bookmarks (optional). If the bookmarks upload into a separate folder outside of the bookmarks bar, you can easily move them. Open the Bookmarks manager. Select the folder with your bookmarks. Select the bookmarks you want to move. Drag the bookmarks to the new location.

steps.title: Plug a flash drive into your computer.
steps.content: Plug a flash drive into your computer. A flash drive is probably the easiest way to quickly transfer your bookmarks to another computer. [9] X Research source If you don’t have a flash drive, you can attach the bookmark file to an email message instead. You can also upload the file to a cloud service, such as iCloud, Google Drive, or OneDrive.

steps.title: Open Firefox and press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+O (PC) or ⌘ Command+⇧ Shift+O (Mac).
steps.content: Open Firefox and press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + O (PC) or ⌘ Command + ⇧ Shift + O (Mac). It’s in the All Apps area of the Start menu in Windows, and the Applications folder in macOS. Pressing the keyboard shortcut opens the Bookmark Manager. [10] X Research source Alternatively, you can go to ☰ > Bookmarks > Manage bookmarks .

steps.title: Click Import and Backup.
steps.content: Click Import and Backup . [11] X Research source

steps.title: Click Export Bookmarks to HTML….
steps.content: Click Export Bookmarks to HTML… . Your computer’s file browser will appear. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to the location where you want to save the bookmarks.
steps.content: Navigate to the location where you want to save the bookmarks. If you’re using a flash drive, browse to the flash drive in the file browser. If you’re going to email yourself the bookmarks or upload it to a cloud service, navigate to your Downloads folder (or anywhere else that’s easy to remember). If you have the cloud service connected to your computer, navigate to its folder.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Your bookmarks will save to the selected location as an HTML file. [13] X Research source When the file is finished saving, safely eject the drive from your computer. If you’re emailing the bookmarks to yourself, open your email client, compose a new message to yourself, attach the file, then click the send button.

steps.title: Plug the flash drive into the new computer.
steps.content: Plug the flash drive into the new computer. [14] X Research source If you emailed yourself the bookmarks or uploaded it to a cloud service, log into your account from the new computer, open the message or file, then download the HTML attachment.

steps.title: Open Firefox on the new computer.
steps.content: Open Firefox on the new computer. Be sure to download Firefox on the new computer if you haven't already. If you want to transfer to a different browser, skip to the importing steps for Google Chrome , Safari , or Microsoft Edge .

steps.title: Press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+O.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + O . This opens the Bookmark Manager in Firefox on the new computer.

steps.title: Click Import and Backup in Firefox.
steps.content: Click Import and Backup in Firefox. This opens your computer’s file browser. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Browse to the bookmark file.
steps.content: Browse to the bookmark file. If you saved the file to a flash drive, navigate to the flash drive. If you downloaded the file from an email message or cloud service, navigate to the folder in which you saved it. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Select the bookmark file and click Open.
steps.content: Select the bookmark file and click Open . This will import your bookmarks into the new browser. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Move the bookmarks (optional).
steps.content: Move the bookmarks (optional). If the bookmarks upload into a separate folder outside of the bookmarks bar, you can easily move it. Open the Bookmarks manager. Select the folder with your bookmarks. Select the bookmarks you want to move. Drag the bookmarks to the new location.

steps.title: Plug a flash drive into your computer.
steps.content: Plug a flash drive into your computer. A flash drive is probably the easiest way to quickly transfer your bookmarks to another computer. If you don’t have a flash drive, you can attach the bookmark file to an email message instead. You can also upload the file to a cloud service, such as iCloud, Google Drive, or OneDrive.

steps.title: Launch Safari and click the File menu.
steps.content: Launch Safari and click the File menu. This is in the top toolbar when Safari is open.

steps.title: Click Export.
steps.content: Click Export . You can find this in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Bookmarks.
steps.content: Click Bookmarks . This will open the Finder. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to the location where you want to save the bookmarks.
steps.content: Navigate to the location where you want to save the bookmarks. If you’re using a flash drive, browse to the flash drive in the Finder. If you’re going to email yourself the bookmarks or upload it to a cloud service, navigate to your Downloads folder (or anywhere else that’s easy to remember). If you have the cloud service connected to your computer, navigate to its folder.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Your bookmarks will save to the selected location as an HTML file. When the file is finished saving, safely eject the drive from your computer. If you’re emailing the bookmarks to yourself, open your email client, compose a new message to yourself, attach the file, then click the send button.

steps.title: Plug the flash drive into the new computer.
steps.content: Plug the flash drive into the new computer. [19] X Research source If you emailed yourself the bookmarks or uploaded it to a cloud service, log into your account from the new computer, open the message or file, then download the HTML attachment.

steps.title: Open Safari on the new computer.
steps.content: Open Safari on the new computer. If you don't have Safari and you're using another Mac, you can download it again from the App Store. If you want to transfer to a different browser, skip to the importing steps for Google Chrome , Mozilla Firefox , or Microsoft Edge .

steps.title: Open the Bookmarks menu again.
steps.content: Open the Bookmarks menu again. Do this by clicking File > Export > Bookmarks .

steps.title: Click Import.
steps.content: Click Import . This will open the Finder.

steps.title: Browse to the bookmark file.
steps.content: Browse to the bookmark file. If you saved the file to a flash drive, navigate to the flash drive. If you downloaded the file from an email message or cloud service, navigate to the folder in which you saved it.

steps.title: Select the bookmark file and click Open.
steps.content: Select the bookmark file and click Open . This will import your bookmarks into the new browser.

steps.title: Move the bookmarks (optional).
steps.content: Move the bookmarks (optional). If the bookmarks upload into a separate folder outside of the bookmarks bar, you can easily move it. Open the Bookmarks menu. Select the folder with your bookmarks. Select the bookmarks you want to move. Drag the bookmarks to the new location.

steps.title: Plug a flash drive into your computer.
steps.content: Plug a flash drive into your computer. A flash drive is probably the easiest way to quickly transfer your bookmarks to another computer. If you don’t have a flash drive, you can attach the bookmark file to an email message instead. You can also upload the file to a cloud service, such as iCloud, Google Drive, or OneDrive.

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge and press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+O (PC) or ⌘ Cmd+⇧ Shift+O (Mac).
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge and press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + O (PC) or ⌘ Cmd + ⇧ Shift + O (Mac). This opens the Favorites menu. Favorites is Microsoft Edge's version of bookmarks. You can also get there by clicking the three dots at the top-right corner of the window and selecting Favorites . https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/open-your-entire-favorites-bar-in-microsoft-edge-1de9c233-759b-d464-7963-72059be83f79

steps.title: Click ••• on the Favorites' window.
steps.content: Click ••• on the Favorites' window. This is at the top of the window. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Export favorites.
steps.content: Click Export favorites . Your computer’s file browser will appear.

steps.title: Navigate to the location where you want to save the bookmarks.
steps.content: Navigate to the location where you want to save the bookmarks. If you’re using a flash drive, browse to the flash drive in the file browser. If you’re going to email yourself the bookmarks or upload it to a cloud service, navigate to your Downloads folder (or anywhere else that’s easy to remember). If you have the cloud service connected to your computer, navigate to its folder.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Your bookmarks will save to the selected location as an HTML file. When the file is finished saving, safely eject the drive from your computer. If you’re emailing the bookmarks to yourself, open your email client, compose a new message to yourself, attach the file, then click the send button.

steps.title: Plug the flash drive into the new computer.
steps.content: Plug the flash drive into the new computer. [20] X Research source If you emailed yourself the bookmarks or uploaded it to a cloud service, log into your account from the new computer, open the message or file, then download the HTML attachment.

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge on the new computer.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge on the new computer. If you don't have Microsoft Edge, you can download it again from the Microsoft app store. If you want to transfer to a different browser, skip to the importing steps for Google Chrome , Mozilla Firefox , or Safari .

steps.title: Press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+O.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + O . This opens the Favorites menu in Microsoft Edge on the new computer.

steps.title: Click ••• on the Favorites' window.
steps.content: Click ••• on the Favorites' window. This is at the top of the window. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Import favorites.
steps.content: Click Import favorites . This opens your computer’s file browser.

steps.title: Click Choose what to import.
steps.content: Click Choose what to import . You can find this under the Import from other browsers header.

steps.title: Browse to the bookmark file.
steps.content: Browse to the bookmark file. If you saved the file to a flash drive, navigate to the flash drive. If you downloaded the file from an email message or cloud service, navigate to the folder in which you saved it.

steps.title: Select the bookmark file and click Open.
steps.content: Select the bookmark file and click Open . This will import your bookmarks into the new browser.

steps.title: Move the bookmarks (optional).
steps.content: Move the bookmarks (optional). If the bookmarks upload into a separate folder outside of the bookmarks bar, you can easily move it. Open the Favorites menu. Select the folder with your bookmarks. Select the bookmarks you want to move. Drag the bookmarks to the new location.
